sources.title: Alimony
sources.description: Small town girl Kitty Traves (Martha Vickers) comes to New York with the idea of getting rich fast. Beginning as a 'model' she then becomes a divorce co-respondent in hotel room frame-ups. When her songwriting boyfriend, Dan Barker (John Beal), runs out of songs and money, she send him back to his loyal, true-blue fiancée, Linda Waring (Hillary Brooke). She moves on to marry a wealth industrialist, with divorce and alimony her only goal.

sources.title: Alimony (1949) CRIME-DRAMA
sources.description:
Stars: Martha Vickers, John Beal, Hillary Brooke
 Director: Alfred Zeisler

 A promising young composer is tempted away from his devoted wife by a fortune-seeking woman who cares more for his prospects than for him.

metadata.Plot: Small town girl Kitty Traves comes to New York with the idea of getting rich fast. Beginning as a 'model' she then becomes a divorce co-respondent in hotel room frame-ups. When her songwriting boyfriend, Dan Barker, runs out of songs and money, she send him back to his loyal, true-blue fiancée, Linda Waring. She moves on to marry a wealth industrialist, with divorce and alimony her only goal.
metadata.Writer: George Bricker, Royal K. Cole, Lawrence Lipton
metadata.Actors: Martha Vickers, John Beal, Hillary Brooke
